Here's a summary of the 1993 film "Tombstone":

"Tombstone" is a western drama directed by George P. Cosmatos, written by Kevin Jarre, and starring Kurt Russell and Val Kilmer.
The film tells the story of Wyatt Earp (Russell) and his brothers Virgil (Sam Elliott) and Morgan (Bill Paxton), who arrive in Tombstone, Arizona in 1879.
The film is loosely based on real events that took place in Tombstone, Arizona during the late 1800s.

However, their plans are soon disrupted by the Cow-boys gang, led by Curly Bill Brocius (Powers Boothe) and Johnny Ringo (Michael Biehn).
